title: delete_role_policy fails to delete a policy who's name is longer than 64 chars

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

delete_role_policy call fails to delete a policy who's name is longer than 64 chars.



### Expected Behavior

This policy can be deleted from the role on the AWS console just fine, so should be replicated on boto3 as well.

### Current Behavior

```
An error occurred (ValidationError) when calling the DeleteRolePolicy operation: 1 validation error detected: Value 'CloudTrailPolicyForCloudWatchLogs_10d32d54-043c-4293-b3b0-2e757d758cd0' at 'roleName' failed to satisfy constraint: Member must have length less than or equal to 64
```

### Reproduction Steps

Create a role policy attached to a role with a name longer than 64 chars and attempt to delete it using aws cli or boto3.



### Possible Solution

Remove >= 64 char limitation for rolePolicy name.

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.26.119

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

MacOS 13.1

title: ApiGateway GetRestApis paginator incorrectly swaps MaxItems and PageSize

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

labels.name: p2
labels.description: This is a standard priority issue

body:
### Describe the issue

The documentation for the GetRestApis paginator states that if the total number of items is greater than `MaxItems`, then `NextToken` will be present in the response.  This is incorrect and can be confirmed by setting `MaxItems` to 1.  When set to 1, only one remote API call is made.  If, however, `PageSize` is set to 1, then the paginator will continuously return pages with 1 item.

The function below works as expected with a `PageSize` param and does not when given `MaxItems`.
```python
def get_api_by_name(api_name: str) -> Optional[str]:
    paginator = client.get_paginator('get_rest_apis')
    has_more_items = True
    next_token : Optional[str] = None
    api_id : Optional[str] = None
    while has_more_items:
        response_iterator = paginator.paginate(
            PaginationConfig={'PageSize': 1, 'StartingToken': next_token}
        )
        for page in response_iterator:
            pprint(page)
            next_token = page.get('NextToken', None)
            has_more_items = next_token is not None
            candidates = [api['id'] for api in page.get('items', []) if api['name'] == api_name]
            if candidates:
                api_id = candidates[0]
                break
    return api_id
```

I can confirm `PageSize` works, as the pprint of the page includes unique ResponseMetadata for each REST API in the account and region (i.e. a 1:1 mapping matching the requested page size)

### Links

https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/apigateway/paginator/GetRestApis.html

title: SSM get_connection_status response doc doesn't match case

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

body:
### Describe the bug

[The docs for SSM `get_connection_status`](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/ssm/client/get_connection_status.html) say the response can be `'Connected'|'NotConnected'` (upper case first letter).

This is not the case. I'm getting a response with a lowercase.

Note that there's no waiters for this API. So I wrote my own while loop, waiting for status to be `Connected`. It was `connected`, so my while loop hangs forever.

### Expected Behavior

Documented response and actual response match in a case sensitive way.

```
boto3.client('ssm').get_connection_status(Target='i-0da29bfd2959949cc')['Status']
```
gives:

```
'Connected'
```

### Current Behavior

Actual response is lowercase. Docs say CamelCase.

### Reproduction Steps

```
boto3.client('ssm').get_connection_status(Target='i-0da29bfd2959949cc')['Status']
```
gives:

```
'connected'
```

### Possible Solution

Please ask the service team to update their documentation to reflect the correct case.

While you're at it, ask them to add a waiter for this call.

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.26.74

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Mac

title: boto3.client.get_object is prepending the bucket name to the file key

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

labels.name: p2
labels.description: This is a standard priority issue

body:
### Describe the bug

I recently updated boto3 to the latest version and I am trying to access a file using `boto3.client.get_object` from my backend. 

I uploaded a file from S3 console at the "root" of the bucket, so I am sure `myfile.png` exists with the specified key. When I try to download it using the code below, it looks like it is incorrectly prepending the bucket name to the file path, so it can't find the file. I keep getting 404 errors:
```
ClientError: An error occurred (NoSuchKey) when calling the GetObject operation: The specified key does not exist.
```

### Expected Behavior

I would expect the object to be found correctly. It was working before updating boto3.

### Current Behavior

I have to move `myfile.png` from the root of the bucket to a folder with the same name as the bucket for boto3 to find the file. So this:
```
obj = storage.get_object(Bucket="my-bucket", Key="myfile.png")['Body']
```
is actually resolving the path to `my-bucket/myfile.png` inside `my-bucket` bucket

### Reproduction Steps
Create a bucket in eu-west-3 region from s3 console and an access point alias to that bucket, and upload a file at the root of the bucket. Create access keys in iam with read access. Run the following code. From s3 console create a folder in the bucket with the same name as the bucket and move the file in it, run the code again

```python
import boto3

storage = boto3.client(
    "s3",
    aws_access_key_id="ACCESS_KEY",
    aws_secret_access_key="SECRET_KEY",
    endpoint_url="https://my-bucket-access-point-alias.s3.eu-west-3.amazonaws.com/"
)

obj = storage.get_object(Bucket="my-bucket", Key="myfile.png")['Body']
```

### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.26.94

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Linux server

body: ### Describe the bug There's an issue which is similar to #3568. When calling the method upload_file with `ChecksumAlgorithm` argument, an empty `Content-Encoding` record will be set in uploaded object's metadata. ### Expected Behavior I would expect no `Content-Encoding` record is set as object's metadata if I don't pass it as argument when uploading a object. ### Current Behavior Without specifying an extra argument for Content Encoding, the object's metadata still have an empty record for this header. ### Reproduction Steps ```python import boto3 s3 = boto3.resource('s3') s3_client = s3.meta.client extra_args = {} extra_args['ChecksumAlgorithm'] = 'SHA1' extra_args['ServerSideEncryption'] = 'AES256' extra_args['ContentType'] = 'text/css' s3_client.upload_file( 'FILE_NAME', 'BUCKET_NAME', 'OBJECT_NAME', extra_args, ) ``` ### Possible Solution _No response_ ### Additional Information/Context _No response_ ### SDK version used 1.26.90 ### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.) Linux

title: S3Control Client fails to accept Operation.S3PutObjectCopy.ChecksumAlgorithm

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

The boto3 docs specify that when creating an S3 Batch Job with `boto3.client('s3control')`, the `ChecksumAlgorithm` is a valid element of a definition of an `S3PutObjectCopy` job. This parameter allows S3 objects to have an additional checksum value calculated and saved on each object in addition to the standard ETag.

When I attempt to pass in the ChecksumAlgorithm parameter as part of the S3PutObjectCopy, the job definition fails to pass validation.

https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/s3control/client/create_job.html

### Expected Behavior

I expect a request like below to pass validation:

`
response = client.create_job(..., Operation={
   'S3PutObjectCopy': {
      ...,
      'BucketKeyEnabled': True|False,
      'ChecksumAlgorithm': 'SHA256'
}})
`

### Current Behavior

Instead, I get the following error:

`"errorMessage": "Parameter validation failed:\nUnknown parameter in Operation.S3PutObjectCopy: \"ChecksumAlgorithm\", must be one of: TargetResource, CannedAccessControlList, AccessControlGrants, MetadataDirective, ModifiedSinceConstraint, NewObjectMetadata, NewObjectTagging, RedirectLocation, RequesterPays, StorageClass, UnModifiedSinceConstraint, SSEAwsKmsKeyId, TargetKeyPrefix, ObjectLockLegalholdStatus, ObjectLockMode, ObjectLockRetainUntilDate, BucketKeyEnabled", "errorType": "ParamValidationError",`

### Reproduction Steps

Submit any request to S3Control Client on the action `create_job` with an S3PutObjectCopy operation and ChecksumAlgorithm specified.



### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.20.32

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Python 3.9 on AWS Lambda

title: Intersphinx Inventory broken as of 1.26.81

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

labels.name: p2
labels.description: This is a standard priority issue

body:
### Describe the issue

Seems that as of 1.26.81 release of boto, intersphinx inventory is broken.

The inventory (https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/objects.inv) has gotten significantly bigger as of 1.26.81 and it does not contain many of the methods that were there before:

You can see airflow documentation builds failing for example here:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/actions/runs/4308610594/jobs/7515244502

The above build shows 155 missing symbols.

This is clearly visible in the sizes of the inventories that jumped from 130 K to 175 K (downloaded by replacing latest by specific versions):

```
⌁ [jarek:~/Downloads] [airflow-3.9] % ls -la objects*
-rw-r--r--@ 1 jarek  staff  130677 Mar  2 08:19 objects_1.26.80.inv
-rw-r--r--@ 1 jarek  staff  175114 Mar  2 08:18 objects_1.26.81.inv
-rw-r--r--@ 1 jarek  staff  175114 Mar  2 08:16 objects_1.26.82.inv
```

The lack of methods can be seen using `sphobjinv` tool (example missing method: `STS.Client.get_caller_identity`) - and you can see that despite bigger size, there are far less number of objects in the inventory:

```
⌁ [jarek:~/code/airflow/docs/_inventory_cache/boto3] [airflow-3.9] main+ 17s 130 ± sphobjinv su ~/Downloads/objects_1.26.80.inv  STS.Client.get_caller_identity

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cannot infer intersphinx_mapping from a local objects.inv.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Project: Boto3 Docs
Version: 1.26.80

21245 objects in inventory.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1 result found at/above current threshold of 75.

:py:method:`STS.Client.get_caller_identity`
```

Compare with:

```
⌁75% [jarek:~/code/airflow/docs/_inventory_cache/boto3] [airflow-3.9] main+ 17s ± sphobjinv su ~/Downloads/objects_1.26.81.inv  STS.Client.get_caller_identity

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cannot infer intersphinx_mapping from a local objects.inv.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Project: Boto3 Docs
Version: 1.26.81

15791 objects in inventory.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

No results found with score at/above current threshold of 75.

Exiting...
```


### Links

https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/objects.inv

title: Cannot use MaxOutputFiles with create_recipe_job for AWS Databrew

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

I am trying to create an AWS Databrew Recipe Job using python. I am reading the boto3 doc here:
https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/databrew.html#GlueDataBrew.Client.create_recipe_job

Under create_recipe_job, the available params for Outputs are:
'CompressionFormat', 'Format', 'PartitionColumns', 'Location', 'Overwrite', 'FormatOptions', 'MaxOutputFiles'

I am trying to set MaxOutputFiles to 1 so that my Databrew Job output is only a single file. I am calling with Python 3.9 this method to create the job including MaxOutputFiles. However I receive an error:

`Unknown parameter in Outputs[0]: \"MaxOutputFiles\", must be one of: CompressionFormat, Format, PartitionColumns, Location, Overwrite, FormatOptions`

This conflicts with the documentation. Without MaxOutputFiles the code is working fine. 

### Expected Behavior

Databrew recipe job should have been created with no error and only 1 output file.


### Current Behavior

Error message received about a parameter being unknown, despite being mentioned in the boto3 documentation for this function.

### Reproduction Steps

```
import boto3
brew_client = boto3.client('databrew','eu-west-1')
recipe_name='Any name'
brew_client.create_recipe_job(
    Name='Job Name',
    LogSubscription='ENABLE',
    MaxCapacity=20,
    Outputs=[
        {
            'Format': 'CSV',
            'Location': {
                'Bucket': 'bucket-test-mustexist',
                'Key': f'output-file-name.csv'
            },
            'MaxOutputFiles': 1,
            'Overwrite': True,
            'FormatOptions': {
                'Csv': {
                    'Delimiter': ','
                }
            }
        }
    ],
    DatasetName='dataset_name',
    RecipeReference={
        'Name': recipe_name,
        'RecipeVersion': '1.0'
    },
    RoleArn='roleARN0000000000000000000000',
    Timeout=90
)
```


### Possible Solution

Looks like the list of acceptable parameters for this function needs to be updated to include MaxOutputFiles


### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

Python 3.7 or 3.9
boto3 version 1.18.50

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Tried on both AWS Lambda and Microsoft Windows

title: Deleting objects?

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

This has been beaten to death, but I am genuinely confused. I am trying to use boto3 to delete objects and all of their versions. Here is my script:

```
def delete_file_boto3(pathList, s3_resource=None, parent_path=None):
    if len(pathList) < 1:
        return True, [], ''
    path = pathList[0]
    errors = []
    parent_path = normalize_address(parent_path)
    client = boto3.client('s3', aws_access_key_id=AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID,
                          aws_secret_access_key=AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY)
    paginator = client.get_paginator('list_object_versions')
    if parent_path:
        response_iterator = paginator.paginate(Bucket=AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME, Prefix=parent_path)
    else:
        response_iterator = paginator.paginate(Bucket=AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME)
    for response in response_iterator:
        versions = response.get('Versions', [])
        versions.extend(response.get('DeleteMarkers', []))
        try:
            for path in pathList:
                for x in response['Versions']:
                    try:
                        if x['Key'] == path:
                            print('Deleting', x['Key'], x['VersionId'])
                            client.delete_object(Bucket=AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME, Key=x['Key'],
                                                 VersionId=x['VersionId'])
                    except KeyError:
                        print('key error on:', response)
                        errors.append(path)
                        continue
                    except botocore.exceptions.ClientError:
                        print(traceback.format_exc())
                try:
                    if x['Key'] == path:
                        # sanity check
                        client.delete_object(Bucket=AWS_STORAGE_BUCKET_NAME, Key=x['Key'])
                except:
                    # expected behavior
                    pass
        except KeyError:
            print('key error on:', response)
            errors.append(path)

    if len(errors) == 0:
        success = True
    else:
        success = False
    return success, errors, path
```

For context, I can successfully upload into the bucket. I have tried setting `AWS_DEFAULT_ACL` to 'public-read' and None. The bucket does not block public access. The account I am using has `AmazonS3FullAccess`. Object Ownership in the bucket is set to ACLs enabled. I don't have MFA for deleting objects turned on for deleting versioned files. Still I get the following error: `botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the DeleteObject operation: Access Denied` 

Any suggestions?

### Expected Behavior

Be able to delete an object in S3.

### Current Behavior

CAnnot delete an object despite mutliple configs. I'm wondering if it is there a specific bucket policy that I'm missing?

### Reproduction Steps

Described above.

### Possible Solution

Updating bucket policy? I've tried multiple configs, with no success though.

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.26.64

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Linux 22.04, Python 3.8

title: Getting Invalid parameter value while attempting modify_db_snapshot_attribute

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

Hi Team, I am trying to use boto3 framework: version 1.9.42  controlled through pip to integrate a feature that allows sharing of manually created snapshot with a specific aws account. 
I am observing an inconsistency of behavior between sharing manual version from aws vs the boto3 documentation and implementation. 

I am able to share the manual version of the snapshot successfully through aws console  and I can verify the information through the network logs: 
`<ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse xmlns="http://rds.amazonaws.com/doc/2014-10-31/">
  <ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResult>
    <DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult>
      <DBClusterSnapshotAttributes>
        <DBClusterSnapshotAttribute>
          <AttributeValues>
            <AttributeValue>***************</AttributeValue>
          </AttributeValues>
          <AttributeName>restore</AttributeName>
        </DBClusterSnapshotAttribute>
      </DBClusterSnapshotAttributes>
      <DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier>test-aashish-snapshot</DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier>
    </DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult>
  </ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResult>
  <ResponseMetadata>
    <RequestId>a2512768-*************</RequestId>
  </ResponseMetadata>
</ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse>`

when I am using the same approach, same profile and token from the local and using the session to perform the 
`	res = destinationRds.modify_db_snapshot_attribute(
		DBSnapshotIdentifier ='test-aashish-snapshot',
		AttributeName = 'restore',
		ValuesToAdd = [destination_account_id]
	)`
I am repeatedly getting error complaining about `db snapshot not found` 
and if I am using the `DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier` instead of `DBSnapshotIdentifier` as per the successful xml  I am getting an error `Unknown parameter in input: "DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier", must be one of: DBSnapshotIdentifier, AttributeName, ValuesToAdd, ValuesToRemove`


### Expected Behavior

expected behavior is : I should be able to use boto3 framwork 1.9.42 or a recent to version of boto3 to perform `sourceRdsClient.modify_db_snapshot_attribute()` to add an  aws account to a given manual snapshot. 

- I did create the kms key and process
- key is attached succesfully to a new snapshot 
- in manual section share the 



### Current Behavior

I am able to share the manual version of the snapshot successfully through aws console  and I can verify the information through the network logs: 
- I did create the kms key and process
- key is attached succesfully to a new snapshot 
- in manual section share the snapshot with a specific account: **successful**.

`<ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse xmlns="http://rds.amazonaws.com/doc/2014-10-31/">
  <ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResult>
    <DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult>
      <DBClusterSnapshotAttributes>
        <DBClusterSnapshotAttribute>
          <AttributeValues>
            <AttributeValue>***************</AttributeValue>
          </AttributeValues>
          <AttributeName>restore</AttributeName>
        </DBClusterSnapshotAttribute>
      </DBClusterSnapshotAttributes>
      <DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier>test-aashish-snapshot</DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier>
    </DBClusterSnapshotAttributesResult>
  </ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResult>
  <ResponseMetadata>
    <RequestId>a2512768-*************</RequestId>
  </ResponseMetadata>
</ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttributeResponse>`


**FAILURE:** 
when I am using the same approach, on the same snapshot after unsharing aws account on aws consosle, 
using the same aws profile and token from the local and using the session and rds client to perform the 

`	res = sourceRdsClient.modify_db_snapshot_attribute(
		DBSnapshotIdentifier ='test-aashish-snapshot',
		AttributeName = 'restore',
		ValuesToAdd = [destination_account_id]
	)`
I am repeatedly getting error complaining about `db snapshot not found` 
and if I am using the `DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier` instead of `DBSnapshotIdentifier` as per the response and request from  successful xml  I am getting an error `Unknown parameter in input: "DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier", must be one of: DBSnapshotIdentifier, AttributeName, ValuesToAdd, ValuesToRemove` **error** 

### Reproduction Steps

**Happy Path:**
- create an encrypted kms key
- copy a snapshot with kms key from pre-existing snapshot
- from manual snapshot share the snapshot with a different aws account.


Error: 
- create a copy snpahot using the kms-key created
- perform `sourceRds.modify_db_snapshot_attribute(
		DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier =snapshot_id,
		AttributeName = 'restore',
		ValuesToAdd = [destination_account_id]
	)`
you would first get error that `DBClusterSnapshotIdentifier` is bad parameter. 

change the request to : `sourceRds.modify_db_snapshot_attribute(
		DBSnapshotIdentifier =snapshot_id,
		AttributeName = 'restore',
		ValuesToAdd = [destination_account_id]
	)`
now you will get `botocore.errorfactory.DBSnapshotNotFoundFault: An error occurred (DBSnapshotNotFound) when calling the ModifyDBSnapshotAttribute operation: DBSnapshot not found` error 

### Possible Solution

please provide either the bug fix or the updated documentation. 

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.9.42

body:
### Describe the bug

When calling the method `put_object` in the S3 client, if the request has a ChecksumAlgorithm specified, the ContentEncoding argument gets overwritten and set to an empty string.

### Expected Behavior

I expect my manually-set ContentEncoding argument to be preserved.

### Current Behavior

Currently the ContentEncoding gets overwritten and set to an empty string.

### Reproduction Steps

```python
import boto3
import gzip

client = boto3.client("s3")
client.put_object(
    Body=gzip.compress(b"test-object"),
    Key="test/key",
    Bucket="test",
    ContentEncoding="gzip",  # I want this to be set to gzip
    ChecksumAlgorithm="SHA1",
)

client.head_object(
    Key="test/key",
    Bucket="test",
    ChecksumMode="ENABLED",
)
```

produces as output:

{'ResponseMetadata': {'RequestId': '...', 'HostId': '...', 'HTTPStatusCode': 200, 'HTTPHeaders': {'x-amz-id-2': '...', 'x-amz-request-id': '...', 'date': 'Thu, 26 Jan 2023 09:25:14 GMT', 'last-modified': 'Thu, 26 Jan 2023 09:25:13 GMT', 'etag': '"..."', 'x-amz-checksum-sha1': '/CTXfXUwTM/KvoFXC7OEpF7/dIA=', 'x-amz-server-side-encryption': 'AES256', 'content-encoding': '', 'accept-ranges': 'bytes', 'content-type': 'binary/octet-stream', 'server': 'AmazonS3', 'content-length': '25'}, 'RetryAttempts': 0}, 'AcceptRanges': 'bytes', 'LastModified': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 26, 9, 25, 13, tzinfo=tzutc()), 'ContentLength': 25, 'ChecksumSHA1': '/CTXfXUwTM/KvoFXC7OEpF7/dIA=', 'ETag': '"75e79ae360a5e94d1c74a7ce1c80599c"', **'ContentEncoding': ''**, 'ContentType': 'binary/octet-stream', 'ServerSideEncryption': 'AES256', 'Metadata': {}}



### Possible Solution

The same issue is being discussed in the Java SDK:
- https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java-v2/issues/3569

_No response_

1.26.57

title: ❗ Upgrade pip to circumvent installation issue ❗

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

body:
Please upgrade your version of pip in order successfully install boto3/botocore packages. 

Ex: `python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip`

This will allow users to install the previous versions of the boto3/botocore rather than the latest versions. 

There are several ongoing issues tracking the underlying installation issues further but in the meantime this is the recommendation.

body:
### Describe the bug

AWS Glue job type: Python shell
AWS Glue version: 1.0
Python version: 3.6
botocore==1.26.16
boto3== 1.29.16

I am using the [get_job_run](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/glue.html#Glue.Client.get_job_run) function to retrieve a Glue Job's Run ID. 

I use the `Arguments` dict from the function's response to uniquely identify a Glue Job run. 
The `Arguments` dict is not available in `get_job_run` and `get_job_runs` response objects.

### Expected Behavior

```python
client = boto3.client('glue')
response = client.get_job_run(JobName=job_name, RunId=job_run_id)
response_dict = response['JobRun']
type(response_dict.get('Arguments'))
>>> <class 'dict'>
```

### Current Behavior

```python
client = boto3.client('glue')
response = client.get_job_run(JobName=job_name, RunId=job_run_id)
response_dict = response['JobRun']
type(response_dict.get('Arguments'))
>>> <class 'NoneType'>
```

### Reproduction Steps

```python
# AWS Glue (v1.0) Python Shell job
import sys
from awsglue.utils import getResolvedOptions

args = getResolvedOptions(sys.argv, ['JOB_NAME'])
job_name = args['JOB_NAME']

client = boto3.client('glue')

def get_job_run_id(job_name):
    response = client.get_job_runs(JobName=job_name)
    return response['JobRuns'][0]['Id']

job_run_id = get_job_run_id(job_name)

response = client.get_job_run(JobName=job_name, RunId=job_run_id)
assert response['JobRun'].get('Arguments') is not None, 'Arguments key is not available in get_job_run response'
```

### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

Tried to downgrade multiple boto3 versions (through 1.22.6), but the behavior was the same

### SDK version used

1.26.16

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Python shell; Glue 1.0

title: Impossible to create a bucket in us-east-1 if underlying botocore session sets another default region

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

body:
### Describe the bug

When creating an S3 client with `region_name=us-east-1` from a `boto3.Session`, if the underlying `botocore.session.Session` is setup with a `botocore.config.Config` that defines a different `region_name`, creating buckets will always fail with an `IllegalLocationConstraintException`

### Expected Behavior

Being able to create buckets in the `us-east-1` region

### Current Behavior

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "scratch_20.py", line 14, in <module>
    client.create_bucket(Bucket="test-bucket-creation-20221111")
  File "site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 495, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 914, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (IllegalLocationConstraintException) when calling the CreateBucket operation: The unspecified location constraint is incompatible for the region specific endpoint this request was sent to.

```
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "scratch_20.py", line 14, in <module>
    client.create_bucket(Bucket="test-bucket-creation-20221111", CreateBucketConfiguration={"LocationConstraint": "us-east-1"})
  File "site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 495, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 914, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (IllegalLocationConstraintException) when calling the CreateBucket operation: The us-east-1 location constraint is incompatible for the region specific endpoint this request was sent to.
```


### Reproduction Steps

```python
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
from botocore.session import Session

config = Config(region_name="eu-west-1")
session = Session()
session.set_default_client_config(config)
boto_session = boto3.Session(botocore_session=session)

client = boto_session.client("s3", region_name="us-east-1")
client.create_bucket(Bucket="test-bucket-creation-20221111") #raises
client.create_bucket(Bucket="test-bucket-creation-20221111", CreateBucketConfiguration={"LocationConstraint": "us-east-1"}) #raises

client = boto_session.client("s3", region_name="ap-southeast-1")
client.create_bucket(Bucket="test-bucket-creation-20221111", CreateBucketConfiguration={"LocationConstraint": "ap-southeast-1"}) #works as expected

```


### Possible Solution

In the example above, it seems like like for the specific case of "us-east-1", the S3 endpoint for "eu-west-1" is still called. 

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

boto3 1.26.1, botocore 1.29.1

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Tested on Ubuntu 20.04 and lambda runtime `python3.9`

body:
### Describe the bug

The Training job created inside a Hyperparameter tuning job does not receive the environment configuration.

## Related SageMaker SDK issues

- https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/2934
- https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/2618
- https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/2311

### Expected Behavior

I'm expecting to be able to set environment variables in training jobs launched under a hyperparameter tuning job.

### Current Behavior

Currently, all training jobs under a hyperparameter tuning job don't receive the environment parameter defined in the Estimator API.

### Reproduction Steps

For example, launching the following training job directly from Estimator API works well. The training job receives the environment variables correctly.

```python
from sagemaker.sklearn.estimator import SKLearn
estimator = SKLearn(
    entry_point='train.py',
    source_dir='../',
    role=role,
    metric_definitions=metric_definitions,
    hyperparameters=hyperparameters,
    instance_count=1,
    instance_type='ml.m5.xlarge',
    framework_version='0.23-1',
    base_job_name='mlflow',
    vpc_config=vpc_config,
    environment={'MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI': 'https://xyz.com/mlflow-np',
                            'OTHER_ENV': 'something'}
)
estimator.fit({'train':train_path, 'test': test_path})
```

If we launch the same estimator object in a hyperparameter tuning job (using HyperparameterTuner API) the training jobs do not receive the environment variables.

```python
estimator = SKLearn(
    entry_point='train.py',
    source_dir='../',      
    role=role,
    instance_count=1,
    instance_type='ml.m5.xlarge',
    hyperparameters=hyperparameters,
    metric_definitions=metric_definitions,
    framework_version='0.23-1',
    py_version='py3',
    vpc_config=vpc_config,
    environment={'MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI': 'https://xyz.com/mlflow-np',
                            'OTHER_ENV': 'something'}
)

hyperparameter_ranges = {
    'n-estimators': IntegerParameter(50, 200),
    'min-samples-leaf': IntegerParameter(1, 10)
}

objective_metric_name = 'median-AE'
objective_type = 'Minimize'

tuner = HyperparameterTuner(estimator,
                            objective_metric_name,
                            hyperparameter_ranges,
                            metric_definitions,
                            max_jobs=20,
                            max_parallel_jobs=10,
                            objective_type=objective_type,
                            base_tuning_job_name='mlflow')

tuner.fit({'train':train_path, 'test': test_path})
```

Other example: [Dummy entry point script and notebook running sagemaker SDK](https://gist.github.com/yuntan/654a936c0cebb4e02505fae2f4a350ef)

### Possible Solution

It looks like the `SageMaker.Client.create_hyper_parameter_tuning_job()` doesn't have the environment configurations as you can see in [SageMaker — Boto 3 Docs 1.9.185 documentation](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/1.9.185/reference/services/sagemaker.html#SageMaker.Client.create_hyper_parameter_tuning_job).

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.26.1

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Windows 11

title: Dynamodb Partiql issue with how to add parameters for an IN statement in a where select

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: This issue or PR still needs to be triaged.

body:
### Describe the bug

When using WHERE field IN in a statement, I expect that I can put the parameters needed for that field IN in the parameters parameter of execute_statement.

Currently It only works for 1 parameter and not a set or list of parameters.
If you put the parameters hardcoded in the string it also works but that's a really huge security risk when accepting user input.

### Expected Behavior

As with the example listed here [example](https://github.com/awsdocs/aws-doc-sdk-examples/blob/main/python/example_code/dynamodb/partiql/scenario_partiql_single.py) I expected to just have to deliver a list of values that I wanted to put in the ? in the IN part.

Something like:
`params = ["normalfieldvalue", ["INfieldValue1", "AnotherInfieldValue2"]]`

### Current Behavior

As with the example listed here [example](https://github.com/awsdocs/aws-doc-sdk-examples/blob/main/python/example_code/dynamodb/partiql/scenario_partiql_single.py) I expected to just have to deliver a list of values that I wanted to put in the ? in the IN part.
I've tried entering a couple of things. A list of values, A set of values, Tuple, dict all generated no error and just evaluated to false.
When I hardcoded the parameter in the statement it worked just fine, but trying to put it in the statement just never gave result.

To see if the issue was with how that example access the client function from a resource type I've also tried to manually do it by supplying it with S, N, NS, SS and L parameters.
S and N parameters did work. I don't know why. But none of the others do.

### Reproduction Steps

test_table has parent as primary key and id as range key
I had 8 records in there 4 each with test_parent1 and test_parent2 as parent
Id was just an up summing of test_* where * was 1-8
As for total_numbers. Both parents had one of 504, 399, 524, 491

`parti_client = boto3.client('dynamodb')`
`stat = "SELECT total_numbers FROM \"test_table\" WHERE parent IN ['test_parent1', 'test_parent2'] AND begins_with(id, ?) AND total_numbers  IN [?]"`
`param = [{"S": "test_"}, {"N": "504"}] # this one returns all records with total_numbers = 504 of both test_parent1 and test_parent2`
`param = [{"S": "test_"}, {"L": [{"N": "504"}, {"N": "399"}, {"N": "524"}, {"N": "491"}]}] # return nothing`
`param = [{"S": "test_"}, {"NS": ["504", "399", "524", "491"}] # returns nothing`
`output = parti_client.execute_statement(Statement=stat, Parameters=param)`

### Possible Solution

Either allow a list/dict/set/tuple to be used per the example I listed way for IN select statements
Or for normal client.execute_statement allow L, NS, SS to be used.

It works when hardcoded in the statement so why shouldn't it work with parameters?

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

boto3 1.24.96

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

AWS Python 3.9

title: DynamoDB import_table gives me exception ResourceInUseException

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

body:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

What I'm trying to do is to run DynamoDB Table import and checking the progress of that task in my python code. I can say that running `import_table` once is fine, because AWS is starting import as expected. Also running multiple times `export_table_to_point_in_time` gives as a result operation status

In reproduction steps I'm providing import part of my python script. In each loop all function parameters are the same, so there is no way to overwrite current import.

### Expected Behavior

As a result of running the same `import_table` function I should receive response from AWS API with current import task details as described in [import_table response documentation](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/dynamodb.html#DynamoDB.Client.import_table)

### Current Behavior

After running `import_table` for the second time to check current progress I'm getting `ResourceInUseException`.

### Reproduction Steps

```python
import_finished = False
while import_finished != True:
        try:
            import_response = dynamodb_client.import_table(
                ClientToken=client_token,
                S3BucketSource={
                    'S3Bucket': s3_bucket_name,
                    'S3KeyPrefix': s3_bucket_prefix
                },
                InputFormat='DYNAMODB_JSON',
                InputCompressionType='NONE',
                TableCreationParameters= dst_table_creation_attributes
            )
        
        except Exception as e:
            print(str(e))
            print("DynamoDB import Failed - exiting with error")
            sys.exit(1)

        if import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportStatus'] == 'COMPLETED':
            import_finished = True
            print(f"Import to Table {dst_table_name} has status {import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportStatus']}")
        elif import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportStatus'] == 'FAILED':
            print(import_response['ImportTableDescription']['FailureMessage'])
            sys.exit(import_response['ImportTableDescription']['FailureCode'])
        elif import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportStatus'] == 'IN_PROGRESS':
            progress = import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportedItemCount']/exportitemcount
            print(f"Progress: {progress:.2f}% All items: {exportitemcount} imported into table items: {import_response['ImportTableDescription']['ImportedItemCount']}")

labels.description: This is a problem with documentation.

labels.name: service-api
labels.description: This issue is caused by the service API, not the SDK implementation.

body:
### Describe the bug

Hi, I have an image that has `100 < N <= 1000` scan findings, and I've noticed that passing the `maxResults` parameter with the `describe_image_scan_findings` call does not affect the number of findings returned. 

### Expected Behavior

I expected that I would get back > 100 results in `response['imageScanFindings']['enhancedFindings']`.

### Current Behavior

I get back exactly 100 findings in `response['imageScanFindings']['enhancedFindings']`, along with a `nextToken`, even though I set `maxResults = 1000`.

### Reproduction Steps

Have an image in ECR with image-scanning enabled that has > 100 findings.

### Possible Solution

my best guess is that the `maxResults` parameter is only applied to `response['imageScanFindings']['findings']`, and not `response['imageScanFindings']['enhancedFindings']`.

### Additional Information/Context

I don't have an image that has > 100 `findings` instead of `enhancedFindings` so I can't validate my hypothesis above. 

### SDK version used

boto3==1.24.73 botocore==1.27.73

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

MacBook Pro M1 (2021), Mac OS Monterey 12.5.1, Python 3.10.6

title: running python script using boto3 code and I expect 6 processes but I only get one

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

body:
### Describe the bug

I have an application I wrote in python that is called aws_copy_backups, which calls aws_pc_backup.  aws_pc_backup does my uploads to s3.  The program works, but I have it configured to run 6 processes but it only uses one.  I do have threads=True set in the config, of course.  I have 12 processes available on my computer to use according to psutil.cpu_count().

### Expected Behavior

I expect 6 processes to be running as a child of the python process.  I don't see any.

### Current Behavior

I'm using windows sysinternals to verify how many processes are running and it clearly shows only one.  I'm expecting 6 children under the python.exe process.  

When I run the sample code as a python script called aws_pc_backup_short.py, I get this in process explorer.  aws_pc_backup_short.py is a shortened version of aws_pc_backup.py.

![aws_pc_backup_short process explorer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71224599/195149105-39fc0abc-df07-4dd4-976a-6ecd6021cf83.jpg)


The command line I execute is as follows:

python aws_pc_backup_short.py -m:u -s:"F:\\My Backups\\New System Backup\\C_VOL-b016.spf" -d:jschwar313-desktp-ufr9q1v-c-drive 

The file I'm uploading is 75.7 GB in size according to windows.

### Reproduction Steps

Here is the python script AWS_PC_BACKUP_Short.py

`import sys
import getopt
import logging
import logging.config
import boto3
import botocore
from botocore import exceptions
import psutil
from boto3.s3.transfer import TransferConfig




LOGGING = {
    "version": 1,
    "disable_existing_loggers": True,
    "formatters": {
        "default":
            {"format": "%(asctime)s - %(name)s - [%(levelname)s] - %(message)s"}
    },
    "handlers": {
        "aws_pc_backup": {
            "class": "logging.StreamHandler",
            "formatter": "default"
        },
        "boto3": {
            "class": "logging.StreamHandler",
            "formatter": "default"
        },
        "botocore": {
            "class": "logging.StreamHandler",
            "formatter": "default"
        }
    },
    "loggers": {
        "aws_pc_backup": {
            "handlers": ["aws_pc_backup"],
            "level": "INFO",
            "propagate": False
        },
        "boto3": {
            "handlers": ["boto3"],
            "level": "INFO",
            "propagate": False
        },
        "botocore": {
            "handlers": ["botocore"],
            "level": "INFO",
            "propagate": False
        }
    }
}


def generic_exception_handler(location, logging_root):
    logging_root.error('Error location is ' + location)
    logging_root.error('Exception Type is ' + str(sys.exc_info()[0]))
    logging_root.error('Exception Value is ' + str(sys.exc_info()[1]))
    logging_root.error('Exception Traceback is ' + str(sys.exc_info()[2]))
    return ()


def copy_to_s3(s3, source, destination, key, extra_args, callback, config, logging_root):
    upload_file_response = {}
    try:
        upload_file_response = s3.upload_file(source, destination, key, ExtraArgs=extra_args, Callback=callback,
                                              Config=config)

    except s3.exceptions.ClientError as err:
        if err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'NoSuchBucket':
            generic_exception_handler("S3 Exception (copy to s3 NoSuchBucket)", logging_root)
            raise err
        else:
            generic_exception_handler("S3 Exception (copy to s3 ClientError)", logging_root)
            raise err

    except botocore.exceptions.ClientError as err:
        if err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'ConnectionClosedError':
            logging_root.info("botocore Exception (copy to s3 ConnectionClosedError - retrying)")
            pass
        elif err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'ConnectTimeoutError':
            logging_root.info("botocore Exception (copy to s3 ConnectionTimeoutError - retrying)")
            pass
        elif err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'ReadTimeoutError':
            logging_root.info("botocore Exception (copy to s3 ReadTimeoutError - retrying)")
            pass
        elif err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'EndpointConnectionError':
            logging_root.info("botocore Exception (copy to s3 EndpointConnectionError - retrying)")
            pass
        elif err.response['Error']['Code'] == 'ConnectionError':
            logging_root.info("botocore Exception (copy to s3 ConnectionError - retrying)")
            pass
        else:
            generic_exception_handler("botocore Exception (copy to s3 ClientError)", logging_root)
            logging_root.error('source is %s' % destination)
            raise err

    except Exception as err:
        generic_exception_handler("Exception (copy to s3 Generic Exception)", logging_root)
        raise err

    return upload_file_response


def upload(s3, source, destination, logging_root):
    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
    copy_response = ''

    mb = 1024 ** 2

    # perform upload
    config = TransferConfig(multipart_threshold=1024 * mb, max_concurrency=int(psutil.cpu_count() / 2),
                            multipart_chunksize=1024 * mb, use_threads=True)
    logging_root.info('file is ' + source)
    copy_response = copy_to_s3(s3, source, destination, str(source)[2:].replace('\\\\', '\\'), None, None,
                               config, logging_root)
    if copy_response is not None:
        logging_root.error('copy response is (3) ' + str(copy_response))

    return copy_response


def main(argv):
    logging.config.dictConfig(LOGGING)
    logging_root = logging.getLogger('aws_pc_backup')
    logging_boto3 = logging.getLogger('boto3')
    logging_botocore = logging.getLogger('botocore')

    source = None
    destination = None
    mode = None
    optlist = []
    args = []
    logging_root.info('Max threads on my machine is ' + str(psutil.cpu_count()))
    logging_root.info('Threads are now hard coded at ' + str(int(psutil.cpu_count() / 2)))

    try:
        optlist, args = getopt.getopt(sys.argv[1:], 'm:s:d:x:t:k:l:h')

    except getopt.GetoptError as e:
        logging_root.error('GetoptError %s: %s %s\n' % (optlist[0], args[0], e.msg))
        logging_root.error(
            'python aws_pc_backup_short.py -m:u -s: <source> -d: <destination> ')
        sys.exit(2)

    logging_boto3.setLevel('DEBUG')
    logging_botocore.setLevel('DEBUG')
    logging_root.setLevel('DEBUG')
    for (opt, arg) in optlist:
        if opt == '-h':
            logging_root.error(
                'python aws_pc_backup_short.py' + ' -m:u -s: <source> -d: <destination> ''')
        elif opt == '-s':
            source = arg[1:]
        elif opt == '-d':
            destination = arg[1:]
        elif opt == '-m':
            logging_root.info('in mode test, arg[1:] is ' + arg[1:] + ' and arg is ' + arg)
            mode = arg[1:]

    logging_root.info('Source is ' + str(source))
    logging_root.info('Destination is ' + str(destination))
    logging_root.info('Mode is ' + str(mode))

    sts = boto3.client('sts')
    try:
        sts.get_caller_identity()
        logging_root.info('Credentials are valid.')
    except sts.exceptions.ClientError:
        logging_root.info('AWS Credentials are NOT valid. Exiting')
        logging_root.info(
            'Please see the following link to set them up:  https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html#guide-credentials')
        sys.exit(12)

    # Create AWS transfer client
    s3 = boto3.client('s3', region_name='us-east-2')
    # s3 = Session().create_client('s3',region_name='us-east-2')

    upload_response = upload(s3, source, destination, logging_root)
    logging_root.info('Upload response is ' + str(upload_response))

    sys.exit(0)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main(sys.argv[0:])
`


### Possible Solution

unknown

### Additional Information/Context

Python 3.10.7

body: ### Describe the bug When creating a SageMaker Endpoint with an Endpoint Configuration with Data Capture enabled, I pass in the value "InputAndOutput" for the DataCaptureConfig.CaptureOptions parameter to log both the prediction requests and predictions. However, when I go to create the Endpoint, I am told that the Endpoint Configuration has been configured improperly. When I was troubleshooting, I noticed that when I switch the DataCaptureConfig.CaptureOptions argument to "Input", a SageMaker Endpoint can be deployed. Moreover, when I switch the DataCaptureConfig.CaptureOptions argument to "Output", a SageMaker Endpoint can be deployed. This leads me to believe there is an issue with passing "InputAndOutput" as a DataCaptureConfig.CaptureOptions argument. ### Expected Behavior I expect to pass InputAndOutput as a DataCaptureConfig.CaptureOptions argument and to have a SageMaker Endpoint be deployed that will capture both prediction requests and predictions sent from the endpoint using the Boto3 Client. ### Current Behavior ### Reproduction Steps ### Possible Solution _No response_ ### Additional Information/Context _No response_ ### SDK version used boto3-1.20.32 botocore-1.23.32 ### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.) Lambda - Python 3.9

### Expected Behavior

I expected boto3 to return all the fields listed in the [documentation for the `describe_user` function](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/identitystore.html#IdentityStore.Client.describe_user).

### Reproduction Steps

Note: I used the same identity store ID and user ID for both examples.

client = boto3.client("identitystore", region_name="us-east-2")
user = client.describe_user(IdentityStoreId="<snip>", UserId="<snip>")
print(json.dumps(user, indent=2))
```

title: Misleading error message with KMS.GenerateDataKey

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

labels.name: service-api
labels.description: This issue is caused by the service API, not the SDK implementation.

body:
### Describe the bug

When calling the KMS GenerateDataKey API, the error messages are incomplete and misleading.

### Expected Behavior

If I enter an invalid KeySpec for KMS's GenerateDataKey API, I expect an error message that suggests valid keyspecs.

### Current Behavior

Instead, the error message for an invalid keyspec is plain wrong:
1. It is missing valid keyspecs
2. It says that _invalid_ keyspecs are accepted

With the keyspec `AES-256` (which should be `AES_256`), I get:
```
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (ValidationException) when calling the GenerateDataKey operation: 1 validation error detected: Value 'AES-256' at 'keySpec' failed to satisfy constraint: Member must satisfy enum value set: [RSA_2048, ECC_NIST_P384, ECC_NIST_P256, ECC_NIST_P521, HMAC_384, RSA_3072, ECC_SECG_P256K1, RSA_4096, SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT, HMAC_256, HMAC_224, HMAC_512]
```
There is no mention of AES, even though `AES_256` _is_ a valid keyspec for `GenerateDataKey()`. boto3 rightly accepts `AES_256` as a keyspec, but the error message does not mention it as a valid option.

With keyspec `RSA_2048`, which the previous error message _claims_ is a valid input, I get:
```
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (ValidationException) when calling the GenerateDataKey operation: 1 validation error detected: Value ‘RSA_2048’ at ‘keySpec’ failed to satisfy constraint: Member must satisfy enum value set: [RSA_2048, ECC_NIST_P384, ECC_NIST_P256, ECC_NIST_P521, HMAC_384, RSA_3072, ECC_SECG_P256K1, RSA_4096, SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT, HMAC_256, HMAC_224, HMAC_512]
```
This says that `RSA_2048` isn't a member of the list that starts with `[RSA_2048,...]`, which is contradictory. `GenerateDataKey()` should not accept `RSA_2048` as a keyspec since it is a public key algorithm, but the boto3 error lists it as a valid keyspec (and then throws an error if you try to use it).

### Reproduction Steps

```
kms_client = boto3.client('kms', region, aws_access_key_id=access, aws_secret_access_key=secret, aws_session_token=token)
response = kms_client.generate_data_key(KeyId='key', KeySpec='AES-256')
```
You can change the KeySpec to `RSA_2048` to get the second error.

### Possible Solution

KMS or Boto3 is confused about which keyspecs are valid for which KMS APIs. `GenerateDataKey()` should only mention _symmetric_ key specs like `AES_256` or `HMAC_256`. `GenerateDataKeyPair()` should only mention public key keyspecs like `RSA_2048` and `ECC_NIST_P256`.

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.17.81

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

AL2

title: s3control mangles TargetLocationPrefix with key, making its behavior unexpected.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

body:
### Describe the bug

When using s3control to copy object, the TargetLocationPrefix is appened with the full object key, instead of just the name of the file.  
Documentation for s3control in boto3 was rather lacking in detail. But in cli it says

> Specifies the folder prefix into which you would like the objects to be copied. For example, to copy objects into a folder named Folder1 in the destination bucket, set the TargetKeyPrefix to Folder1 .

However when I tried this... I would get s3://test_bucket/Folder2/Folder1/test_object.txt instead of s3://test_bucket/Folder2/test_object.txt

### Expected Behavior

A file in location s3://test_bucket/Folder2/test_object.txt

### Current Behavior

A file in location s3://test_bucket/Folder2/Folder1/test_object.txt

### Reproduction Steps

```
import json
import time
import uuid
from typing import List, Tuple, Union
from collections import defaultdict
import boto3


# print(all_keys)
def get_partition():
    if boto3.session.Session().region_name in ["cn-northwest-1", "cn-north-1"]:
        return "aws-cn"
    else:
        return "aws"


partition = get_partition()
region_name = boto3.session.Session().region_name
account_id = boto3.client('sts').get_caller_identity().get('Account')
s3 = boto3.client("s3", region_name=region_name)
s3control = boto3.client('s3control', region_name=region_name)


def copy_objects_to_location(objects: List[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]]], dst_bucket, dst_prefix):
    if dst_prefix[-1] != "/":
        dst_prefix += '/'

    batchOperationsRole = f"arn:{partition}:iam::{account_id}:role/ml-ops-S3BatchOperations"  # WARNING: create a role for this.
    # boto3.set_stream_logger('')

    manifest_csv = ""
    for key in objects:
        if isinstance(key, str):
            bucket = key.split('/')[2]
            prefix = '/'.join(key.split('/')[3:])
        else:
            bucket, prefix = key
        manifest_csv += f"{bucket},{prefix}\n"
    # print(manifest_csv)

    # upload the manifest file to s3://{src_bucket}/{src_prefix}/manifest.csv
    manifest_key = f"s3_control_manifests/manifest_{uuid.uuid4()}.csv"
    manifest_uri = f"s3://{dst_bucket}/{manifest_key}"
    manifest_arn = f"arn:{partition}:s3:::{dst_bucket}/{manifest_key}"
    response = s3.put_object(
        Body=manifest_csv,
        Bucket=dst_bucket,
        Key=manifest_key
    )
    etag = boto3.resource('s3').Object(dst_bucket, manifest_key).e_tag.strip('"')
    print(f"Uploaded manifest to {manifest_uri}.")

    dst_bucket_arn = f"arn:{partition}:s3:::{dst_bucket}"

    kwargs = {
        "AccountId": account_id,
        "ConfirmationRequired": False,
        "RoleArn": batchOperationsRole,
        "Priority": 10,
        "Manifest": {
            "Spec": {
                "Format": "S3InventoryReport_CSV_20161130",
                "Fields": ["Bucket", "Key"],
            },
            "Location": {
                "ObjectArn": manifest_arn,
                "ETag": etag
            },
        },
        "Operation": {
            'S3PutObjectCopy': {
                "TargetResource": dst_bucket_arn,
                'TargetKeyPrefix': dst_prefix,
                "MetadataDirective": "COPY",
                "RequesterPays": False,
                "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            },
        },
        "Report": {
            #   'Bucket': dst_bucket_arn,
            #   'Format': 'Report_CSV_20180820',
            'Enabled': False,
            #   'Prefix': dst_prefix,
            #   'ReportScope': 'AllTasks',
        },
        "Tags": [{
            "Key": "cost_batch_operation",
            "Value": "yolo_data_something"
        }]
    }

    print(json.dumps(kwargs, indent=4))
    job_id = s3control.create_job(**kwargs)['JobId']

    status = None
    while status not in ['Complete', 'Cancelled', 'Failed', 'Suspended']:
        response = s3control.describe_job(
            AccountId=account_id,
            JobId=job_id
        )
        status = response['Job']['Status']
        print('status', status)
        print(response)
        time.sleep(10)

    if status in ['Cancelled', 'Failed', 'Suspended']:
        raise Exception(f'Jobid {job_id} has error status of {status}')

copy_objects_to_location([('test_bucket','Folder1/tesst.txt'), 'test_bucket', 'Folder2']) # copies to Folder2/Folder1/test.txt

```
### Possible Solution

Either TargetKeyPrefix should be the parent key path + the name of file or there needs to be a boolean that enables standard s3 cp  behavior such as S3CPBehavior:true

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.24.74

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

python 3.9

body:
### Describe the bug

DescribeAddresses fails with the following error whenever describe_region(**AllRegions=True**)["Regions"] Allregions flag is set.

**Appropriate permission were assigned to the pragmatic user and the same operation works without any problem when AllRegions=True flag isn't set.** 

**Error:**
`botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (AuthFailure) when calling the DescribeAddresses operation: AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials`

**More Info**: 

We've had this problem for a whille, Initially af-south-1 region was having the same issue but now that region works but eu-south-1 doesn't. The error was the same in the initial case i.e africa.It fails only on those regions and we need to use those regions as part of our workflow.


### Expected Behavior

The **DescribeAddresses** operation is supposed to work properly and give the IP address in response.

### Current Behavior

Fails with the following error though appropriate permission were assigned and credentials work.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 14, in <module>
    addresses_dict = client.describe_addresses()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/botocore/client.py", line 508, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/botocore/client.py", line 915, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (AuthFailure) when calling the DescribeAddresses operation: AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials
```

The same action works when the flag is not set but it doesn't have all the regions and only some regions.

### Reproduction Steps

Attaching a POC script.

```
import boto3

ec2 = boto3.client('ec2')

# Retrieves all regions/endpoints that work with EC2
aws_regions = [
            region["RegionName"] for region in ec2.describe_regions(AllRegions=True)["Regions"]
        ]
for region in aws_regions:
	print(region)
	profile_session = boto3.session.Session(profile_name="production")
	client = profile_session.client("ec2", region_name=region)
	print("Obtaining IP's")
	addresses_dict = client.describe_addresses()
	print(addresses_dict)
```

### Possible Solution

I'm not really sure why this is happening since it's supposed to work logically.

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

boto3  1.24.47             

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Ubuntu 20.04.4

title: Pinpoint client's `tag_resource` and `list_tags_for_resource` has stopped working

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: pinpoint
labels.description: A low-level client representing Amazon Pinpoint

body:
### Describe the bug

```
import boto3
session = session()
client = session.client('pinpoint')

client.tag_resource(
    ResourceArn='bla',
    TagsModel={
        'tags': {'foo': 'bar'},
    }
)
```

returns 
```
botocore.errorfactory.InternalServerErrorException: An error occurred (InternalServerErrorException) when calling the TagResource operation (reached max retries: 4): Internal server error
```

Same for `list_tags_for_resource`


### Expected Behavior

I expected to successfully tag resource and retrieve resource's tags.

### Current Behavior

Request fails with `Internal server error` after 4 retries.

### Reproduction Steps

```
import boto3
session = session()
client = session.client('pinpoint')

client.tag_resource(
    ResourceArn='bla',
    TagsModel={
        'tags': {'foo': 'bar'},
    }
)
```

```
import boto3
session = session()
client = session.client('pinpoint')

client.list_tags_for_resource(ResourceArn='bla')
```


### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

1.24.25

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

macOS Monterey 12.5, Python 3.8.13

title: SQS get_paginator for list_queues only returning 1000 items

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

labels.name: service-api
labels.description: This issue is caused by the service API, not the SDK implementation.

body:
### Describe the bug

When using the paginator with list_queues I can only get 1000 max results unless I explicily define PageSize - never seen this on any other service and to me, this feels like a bug?

### Expected Behavior

Returns complete list of SQS Queues

### Current Behavior

Returns 1000

### Reproduction Steps

```
#
# Pagination - Broken
#
queues = [
    queue
    for page in sqs.get_paginator('list_queues').paginate()
    for queue in page.get('QueueUrls', [])
]
print('Paginator:', len(queues)) # Prints 1000

#
# Pagination - Works
#
queues = [
    queue
    for page in sqs.get_paginator('list_queues').paginate(
        PaginationConfig={
            'PageSize': 1000
        }
    )
    for queue in page.get('QueueUrls', [])
]
print('Paginator:', len(queues)) # Prints 2097

#
# NextToken - Works
#
queue_count = 0
params = {
    'MaxResults': 1000
}
while True:
    queues = sqs.list_queues(**params)

    for queue in queues.get('QueueUrls', []):
        queue_count += 1

    next_token = queues.get('NextToken')
    if next_token:
        params['NextToken'] = next_token
    else:
        break
print('NextToken:', queue_count) # Prints 2097
```

### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

boto3/1.23.6 botocore/1.26.6

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Ubuntu 22.04

title: ElasticLoadBalancerV2 modify_rule() not working

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

labels.name: response-requested
labels.description: Waiting on additional information or feedback.

labels.name: ElasticLoadBalancing
labels.description: A low-level client representing Elastic Load Balancing

body:
### Describe the bug

When modifying Loadbalancer Rule using modify_rule()
I am having trouble when I want to change rule's conditions from having only `host-header` to having 2 conditions `host-header` & `source-ip`
Document stated that: 
>To add an item to a list, remove an item from a list, or update an item in a list, you must provide the entire list
https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/elbv2.html#ElasticLoadBalancingv2.Client.modify_rule

When I want to add to the rule a `source-ip` condition so that only IPs in list are allow to access,
I provided the old `host-header` value and the `source-ip` I want to add.
The code worked previously but it's not working when I ran it in 2022/08/26

```python3
lbChangeRes = lb.modify_rule(
  RuleArn = 'arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:ap-northeast-1:AAA:BBB',
  Conditions = [
      {
          'Field': 'host-header',
          'Values': [
              'example.com',
          ],
      },
      {
          'Field': 'source-ip',
          'SourceIpConfig': {
              'Values': [
                  8.8.8.8,
                  8.4.8.4
              ]
          },
      }
  ]
)
```


### Expected Behavior

Listen's rule changing 
・From
Host: example.com

・To
Host: example.com
IP: 8.8.8.8 OR 8.4.8.4

### Current Behavior

```json
{
  "errorMessage": "An error occurred (ValidationError) when calling the ModifyRule operation: Condition values must be unique",
  "errorType": "ClientError",
  "requestId": "874f7b10-e7f3-4682-85d4-2ff2b31fea77",
  "stackTrace": [
    "  File \"/var/task/lambda_function.py\", line 16, in lambda_handler\n    lbChangeRes = lb.modify_rule(\n",
    "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/client.py\", line 391, in _api_call\n    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)\n",
    "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/client.py\", line 719, in _make_api_call\n    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)\n"
  ]
}
```

### Reproduction Steps

Please create a load balancer and run the code provided in Description

### Possible Solution

_No response_

### Additional Information/Context

_No response_

### SDK version used

boto3-1.20.32 botocore-1.23.32

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Lambda For Python 3.9

labels.name: investigating

labels.name: service-api

body:
### Describe the bug

Hi, 

I'm trying to create a Bucket Intelligent Tiering Configuration by python3 using the boto3.
Source code: 

```
import boto3
s3_client = boto3.client('s3')
s3_client.put_bucket_intelligent_tiering_configuration(
                Bucket='my-bucket',
                Id='intelligent_tiering',
                IntelligentTieringConfiguration={
                    "Id": "deep_archieve",
                    "Status": "Enabled",
                    "Tierings": [{
                            "Days": 180,
                            "AccessTier": "DEEP_ARCHIVE_ACCESS"
                    }]
                }
            )
```
And here is the error when I call the put_bucket_intelligent_tiering_configuration function.
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "my_script.py", line 13, in <module>
    s3_client.put_bucket_intelligent_tiering_configuration(
  File "/Users/dienha/.pyenv/versions/3.8.6/lib/python3.8/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 508, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/Users/dienha/.pyenv/versions/3.8.6/lib/python3.8/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 915, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (MalformedXML) when calling the PutBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration operation: The XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our published schema
```

boto3 version: 1.24.43
botocore version: 1.27.43


Is there anyone occurred in this issue? 
Thanks


### Expected Behavior

Should create a Bucket Intelligent Tiering Configuration

### Current Behavior

Failed with error

```
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (MalformedXML) when calling the PutBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration operation: The XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our published schema
```

### Reproduction Steps

Run below script:

body:
### Sharing transit Gateway using Boto3 Resource Access Manager client

When using the Boto3 client for AWS Resource Access Manager (RAM) to create a resource share, I can see that the resource share is created successfully. However, I noticed that the shared resource (transit gateway) under the created resource share is reporting `The specified resource could not be found in your AWS account`

Here is how I am running the command
```
    client = boto3.client('ram')
    create_response = client.create_resource_share(
            name="test-share",
            resourceArns=[
                'arn:aws:ec2:us-west-2:***:transit-gateway/tgw-0807d39406204ae23'
            ],
            principals=[
                ****, # AccountId I am sharing with
            ],
            allowExternalPrincipals=True,
            clientToken=str(uuid.uuid1()),
            permissionArns=[
                'arn:aws:ram::aws:permission/AWSRAMDefaultPermissionTransitGateway'
            ]
     )
```
I do not get any errors when executing the above command, instead, i get a success message as such 
```
{ 'resourceShare': {'resourceShareArn': 'arn:aws:ram:us-west-2:***:resource-share/168fc6bc-83c3-4400-9ae8-8c9fdfe5f2c5', 'name': 'transit-gateway-share-with-***', 'owningAccountId': '***', 'allowExternalPrincipals': True, 'status': 'ACTIVE', 'creationTime': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 24, 7, 1, 8, 811000, tzinfo=tzlocal()), 'lastUpdatedTime': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 24, 7, 1, 8, 811000, tzinfo=tzlocal())}, 
```

I am trying to share a transit gateway, I can share the transit gateway manually using the console or using the following AWS CLI command. 
```
aws ram create-resource-share \
--name resource-share-test \
--resource-arns "arn:aws:ec2:us-west-2:***:transit-gateway/tgw-0807d39406204ae23" \
--principals *** \
--allow-external-principals \
--permission-arns "arn:aws:ram::aws:permission/AWSRAMDefaultPermissionTransitGateway" \
--region us-west-2
```

I am using the exact same transit gateway ARN, for creating the sharing in all three methods; that is creating the resource share using Boto3, AWS Console, and AWS CLI. 


### Expected Behavior

A resource share is created and the transit gateway is associated.

### Current Behavior

Resource share is created and status is `Active`
![Screen Shot 2022-08-24 at 1 13 50 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100150616/186354868-4aec44ad-7052-4ef6-82cc-dd55e18f295c.png)

However, the Shared resources status under the resource share is reporting `Failed`
![Screen Shot 2022-08-24 at 1 17 19 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100150616/186355551-88f7ad49-e967-4a66-be3f-e42aa54e27c9.png)



### Reproduction Steps

```
    client = boto3.client('ram')
    try:
        create_response = client.create_resource_share(
            name="test-share",
            resourceArns=[
                transit_gateway_arn
            ],
            principals=[
                principle_account_id
            ],
            allowExternalPrincipals=True,
            clientToken=str(uuid.uuid1()),
            permissionArns=[
                'arn:aws:ram::aws:permission/AWSRAMDefaultPermissionTransitGateway'
            ]
        )
       print (create_response)
        
    except ClientError as e:
       print("print exception")
    
```

### Expected Behavior

delete_canary allow two parameters 'Name' and 'DeleteLambda' according to the [boto3 documentation](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/synthetics.html#Synthetics.Client.delete_canary) like below.

import boto3
synthetics = boto3.client('synthetics')
synthetics.delete_canary(Name=canary_name, DeleteLambda=True)

{"errorMessage": "Parameter validation failed:\nUnknown parameter in input: \"DeleteLambda\", must be one of: Name", "errorType": "ParamValidationError", "requestId": "70eb1f1b-766e-4e8e-a927-d4daa463d1ed", "stackTrace": ["  File \"/var/task/canary_deleter.py\", line 28, in lambda_handler\n    response = synthetics.delete_canary(Name=canary_name, DeleteLambda=True)\n", "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/client.py\", line 391, in _api_call\n    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)\n", "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/client.py\", line 691, in _make_api_call\n    request_dict = self._convert_to_request_dict(\n", "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/client.py\", line 739, in _convert_to_request_dict\n    request_dict = self._serializer.serialize_to_request(\n", "  File \"/var/runtime/botocore/validate.py\", line 360, in serialize_to_request\n    raise ParamValidationError(report=report.generate_report())\n"]}

labels.description: This issue is a confirmed bug.

body:
### Describe the bug

When waiting for an ecs fargate task to start we receive an exception 

**Timeout waiting for ECS task to start: Waiter TasksRunning failed: Waiter encountered a terminal failure state: For expression "failures[].reason" we matched expected path: "MISSING" at least once**

When checking the fargate state the task is still in a pending state, and eventually completes successfully.


```
           ecs = boto3.client('ecs')
            run_task_result = ecs.run_task(...)
            waiter = ecs.get_waiter('tasks_running')
            try:
                waiter.wait(cluster='maestro-exec-cluster', tasks=task_arns)
                logger.debug(f'Task {task_arns[0]} has started running')
            except Exception as e:
                error = True  # will update task execution to error
                timeout = True
                error_message = f"Timeout waiting for ECS task to start: {str(e)}"
                logger.error(error_message)
```




### Expected Behavior

Wait should not throw an exception while instance is still in pending state

### Current Behavior

An exception sometimes occurs if the instance takes a while to stand up

### Reproduction Steps



```
           ecs = boto3.client('ecs')
            run_task_result = ecs.run_task(...)
            waiter = ecs.get_waiter('tasks_running')
            try:
                waiter.wait(cluster='maestro-exec-cluster', tasks=task_arns)
                logger.debug(f'Task {task_arns[0]} has started running')
            except Exception as e:
                error = True  # will update task execution to error
                timeout = True
                error_message = f"Timeout waiting for ECS task to start: {str(e)}"
                logger.error(error_message)
```

### Possible Solution

We added a delay just before the try/catch, this seemed to mitigate the issue. Boto should implement proper waiting/validation.

### Additional Information/Context

We opened a case with the Step Function Team, who called in an ecs expert who suggested the ticket appears to be boto3 related, and suggested we open a case here on github. For reference our Case ID is 10579757561

### SDK version used

1.24.42

### Environment details (OS name and version, etc.)

Lambda, Linux

### Describe the bug

Hi everyone, 

I have encountered an issue and I didn't find the problem.

I am using "modify_db_instance" under "RDS" resource, to modify AWS RDS clusters and I noticed that everything that I pass to the function actually change EXCEPT for what I pass to the "BackupRetentionPeriod" which is what I need to be changed the most.

Here is an example of the code block:

cluster_res = rds_client.modify_db_cluster(
            DBClusterIdentifier=dbClusterName,
            ApplyImmediately=True,
            BackupRetentionPeriod=**clusterRetentionPeriod**,
            PreferredBackupWindow='04:00-04:30',
            PreferredMaintenanceWindow='Tue:05:00-Tue:05:30',
            )

**clusterRetentionPeriod** is set above and can be either 2, 7 or 30.

Note 1:
RDS Engines which I work with are: "aurora", "aurora-mysql", "docdb".

Note 2:
I can confirm that backup window and preferred backup window actually change, and I checked that the var "clusterRetentionPeriod" actually has a valid number at runtime, I can't figure out what's the issue then, everything seems to be changing except for the backup retention period.

Note 3:
I notice that the same code block works and actually change the BackupRetentionPeriod for "mariadb" engine RDS.

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks,
Or.

backup period retention will not change after running the script.

            PreferredBackupWindow='04:00-04:30',
